text: the field looping looping looping
looping hi everyone Anthony Fantana here
internet's
busiest music nerd and it's time for an
album review the new the field LP
looping state of mind the field is and
always has been the minimal techno
project of electronic music producer
Wilner he's from sweden I think it's
really funny and interesting that on his
third LP he quite literally comes out
and suggests with the title the kind of
listening experience that that you're
actually in for with his music but
there's definitely some advancement
being shown on this thing
I think the sounds on this thing are
beefier lower frequencies higher
frequencies more effects on some of
these sounds more texture I love the
beats the drums on this thing they've
just got this really nice body to them
they have a lot of push but they're not
like you know bangers the beats on this
thing I can really just grab on and just
hold tight for the duration of an entire
track and I'm just into it I feel like a
lot of producers can throw four beats on
the floor that's cool but very rarely
does it actually feel like it grooves to
me and that's how I feel with this album
though and I think it's mostly because
there's a lot of attention to detail on
this thing these little rhythmic
flourishes that surround the beats
especially on the opening track it
actually kind of reminds me of listening
to for tetes latest LP there's lovin you
yeah there's plenty of repetition on
this thing but they're these very subtle
subtle subtle embellishments that
surround the rhythms that surround the
melodic and harmonic elements of this
album - the way the synthesizers in the
background of is this power kind of
swell very slowly as the song reaches
the end on this LP
a lot of the changes and the shifts just
happen so slowly and subtly it really
holds my attention because I'm just
really locked into observing what's
going on here it's kind of like putting
life into slow motion while still being
able to think in real-time it's kind of
weird to me this album is equal parts
mesmerizing and engaging so I I think my
explanation as to why I like this album
is is pretty simple and it can only be
simple because this is a pretty
simplistic album but not in a bad way I
just think it's interesting that what is
happening on this album to me seems kind
of obvious and yet it works so well it
sounds so good and for some reason a lot
of producers overlook this kind of style
this kind of aesthetic but that's not to
say that I think this album is perfect
or that I think it's without its lower
points one of my least favorite moments
is on the third track of this album
burned out it's something that also
happens on the last track of this album
too and for some reason it just really
rubs me the wrong way like I said
earlier I find this album really
mesmerizing and I like that feeling I
like kind of feeling hypnotized by the
repetition and the textures of this
album but this third song there are
these really disembodied vocals floating
around in the air surrounding this track
and I don't know they're just kind of
killing my buzz they just don't feel
like they fit into the song at any point
for me whereas everything is locked into
this rhythmic Tetris puzzle where
everything has a place and everything
has a purpose these vocals are kind of
calling out and not really adding
anything just kind of distracting like I
said that happens on the last track too
but I think I may like that track even
less because the beat is a little off
for me it kind of sounds like listening
to a copy-machine make about 2000 copies
non-stop it's not a traditional rhythm
and that's fine I'm cool with that I
think I actually would have liked the
track a little bit more if I felt like
that song offered as much progression as
many of the other tracks on this album
do sure I have a few reservations but
the tracks on this thing that I loved I
loved a lot and for sure I will be
digging into the fields previous albums
a little bit more now that I have
listened to this and I liked it for the
most part kind of feeling a decent too
strong seven on this but what do you
think do you like this thing do you hate
it are you in a looping state of mind
and if not why and what should I review
next you have any Fantan out the field
you
